text: Uíge (pronounced: "Weej"), is one of the eighteen provinces of Angola.James, pp. 135 ff It is in the northwestern part of the country. The capital city is Uíge. There are 500,000 people. The Beu Forest Reserve is in the province. The province was badly damaged during the long civil war. Many buildings were destroyed. Many people had to move. ==References== Category:Provinces of Angola
title: Uíge Province
